entry.title: Superman Shivers
entry.summary:
Author: ninaiskawii

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,042Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Gotham never sleeps; it only dreams, and those dreams are dark.Superman trails behind Batman across the city's rooftops, determined to understand the man who moves like a shadow. As the night continues, Clark starts to feel something unusual taking hold- heaviness, cold, and weakness. Superman doesn't get sick.However, Gotham is filled with more than just rain and smoke.

entry.title: Too Good to be True
entry.summary:
Author: Belayoda

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 80,992Chapters: 8/11Kudos: 254

Summary: This is the story of how Bruce Wayne - billionaire, socialite, future CEO of Wayne Enterprises (once his father retires) - fell in love with Superman, and then Kal-El, and then Clark Kent. And it all happened because Superman saved him from a collapsing building. The rest is history, as they say. Oh and by the way, what is a ‘Bat-Man’?“Oh please,” Bruce smirked, trying to hide most of his swooning behind bravado, “Mr Wayne is my father - call me Bruce.” And in his incessant manners, held out a hand for the man to shake, while properly taking in his saviour for the first time. He was wearing a bright blue and red get up, with a large ‘S’ plastered over his chest. It was a bit garish, but Bruce could see the outline of his muscles through the tight suit, so he wasn’t complaining. The man looked surprised at Bruce’s comment before smiling timidly and shaking the outheld hand. “Superman,” he replied.In which Bruce Wayne lives his dream life. Or so it seems.

entry.title: Please Notice Me, Mr. Wayne!
entry.summary:
Author: alohamoron

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,406Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 378

Summary: Clark Kent is a clumsy journalist with a big problem. He has been obsessed with Gotham’s billionaire Bruce Wayne for months, and that obsession is slowly turning into something more like genuine romantic admiration. Determined to get closer, he hatches a plan to have Batman deliver his messages to Bruce Wayne without ever saying a word himself. Of course, nothing goes as planned. Signals get hilariously crossed, schemes backfire, and Clark ends up tangled up in more chaos with Batman while still obsessing over Bruce. He has no idea that Bruce and Batman are actually the same man.

entry.title: Gotham's Blessings
entry.summary:
Author: Raeindeer

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,566Chapters: 2/4Kudos: 35

Summary: All Gothamites having an unspoken understanding that Gotham changes her people. She sinks her claws deep into their beings, seizing them by their essence, and alters them. First is the Bat. Then comes an Owl who soon fosters their own Robin. As the nest grows, a Robin is prematurely plucked. From the dregs a baby bird tries to hold its flock together. Somewhere along the lines, a grounded bird finds their way back into her confides. Eventually, the nest is filled. Or: Gotham stakes her claim on the Bat and his Birds, leaving them a little less human than they once were. This changes everything and nothing at all.

entry.title: Bloodbound
entry.summary:
Author: konota

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,973Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 6

Summary: In this universe, vampirism is a bloodbound curse, passed not through infection nor bite, but through the deliberate exchange of blood—a symbolic and literal act of rebirth. They can eat normal human food, but their bodies cannot process it for nourishment. Blood, however, contains everything they need to survive. Human blood is the richest source, packed with the vital energy that sustains their bodies and fuels their unnatural strength. Animal blood can keep them alive, but it lacks the nutrients and potency of human life. Vampires can walk in sunlight, but doing so weakens and fatigues them: their cells no longer regulate or regenerate properly, drinking fresh blood restores this lost energy, healing wounds and strengthening their power. Though they are far stronger and faster than humans, their bodies are not indestructible—they can bleed, bruise, and break like anyone else. Their senses are heightened: they can hear a heartbeat through walls and smell the faintest trace of life on the air.

entry.title: four people to a marriage
entry.summary:
Author: C4ndyN3cklace

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,190Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 20

Summary: The deadlines are really taking a tole now; Clark’s rent has been due for so long his new worry is the next payment, the farm is under threat by the bank, he still doesn’t have the quotes he needs for an investigative article on high society—and their connection to organised crime—he was poking around for during a gala. …Which he never got around to. Instead, he got Bruce Wayne’s ‘personal’ number and stumbled his way into a very formal date—and a less than night. So now he’s laying in-between steam pressed sheets dreading when Brucie Wayne steps out of the hotel bathroom. — It’s time to lay Brucie Wayne to rest. The Penguin, apparently, has had his claws curled around the upperclass of Gotham for a while longer than Batman had ever thought. His influence runs deep but the numbers—bank transfers, unexpected marriages, random disappearances—run deeper. His own parents were apart of this, knowingly or not, and Batman needs the proof to cement Cobblepots’s arrest. He has, however, recently been confronted by a roadblock. A bank account, possessing a fortune of dirty money, not to be released to Mr. Wayne until he’s taken a Mrs. Or been pronounced married, the bank doesn’t care.

entry.title: Devour Me
entry.summary:
Author: TPWK28HS

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,929Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 22

Summary: That night, Bruce Wayne didn’t just lose his parents… he also lost the ability to taste anything. He awakened as a Folk: nothing fills him, nothing can satisfy the emptiness inside. The Joker takes every chance to tempt him, but his flavor, though intense, is so cloying and nauseating that it pushes Bruce to the edge, making him hate Cakes. Until he tastes him.Clark Kent. A reporter who, by accident, reveals himself to be a Cake. But not just any Cake: to Bruce, he’s addictive, igniting him instantly and leaving him with a single desire… to devour him again. Clark promises to keep the secret, but he runs. Bruce won’t allow it. From that moment on, Kent becomes his obsession. Yet Clark, despite all his empathy, hides an even greater secret: he must conceal that he is Superman. He tries to escape this dangerous game, but when his family’s farm is at risk, Bruce offers him a deal he can’t refuse: save it… in exchange for becoming his sustenance. A convenient arrangement… or the beginning of a bond that will devour everything?

Summary: Superman doesn’t want to be a father to Superboy and decides to send the boy away But Batman is having none of it and does the only logical thing…..brings Superboy to Gotham and introduced him to his family So how will Clark react when he wants to finds his son so he can apologize, and finds out his son has been adopted by Bruce Wayne? Oh, and apparently his name is Conner now!
